title: UFO sightings in India
html:
UFO sightings in India

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article uses bare URLs, which are uninformative and vulnerable to link rot. Several templates and tools are available to assist in formatting, such as Reflinks (documentation), reFill (documentation) and Citation bot (documentation). This is a list of alleged sightings of UFOs in India:

Contents

  • 1 Pre-historic era
  • 2 1951
  • 3 2004
  • 4 2007
  • 5 2013
  • 6 2014
  • 7 2015
  • 8 2021
  • 9 References
  • 10 External links

Pre-historic era[edit]

  • Pre-historic rock cave paintings related to Hinduism found at Charama, Kanker Chhattisgarh state depict human figures wearing suits similar to modern day space suits and drawings similar to flying saucers, each with a fan-like antenna and three legs.[1]

1951[edit]

  • On 15 March, 10:20 a.m. in New Delhi, members of a flying club saw a cigar-shaped object in the sky which was about one hundred feet long. The UFO hovered for some time and then vanished from the sight.[2]

2004[edit]

  • On September 24, a team of scientists in Samudra Tapu spotted a white object resembling a "snow man" on top of an adjacent mountain ridge at around 6:45 a.m. India Today speculated the UFO could be "a spy drone from across the border" or "a weather balloon".|[3]

2007[edit]

  • On October 29, a fast moving object was spotted at 30° in the eastern horizon at Eastern Kolkata between 3:30 and 6:30 am and was filmed using a video camera. Its shape shifted from a sphere to a triangle and then to a straight line. The object emitted a bright light forming a halo and radiated a range of colours. It was spotted by locals and hundreds gathered along the E.M. Bypass to catch a glimpse of the UFO, triggering a frenzy. The video footage was released on a TV News channel and later shown to Dr. D P Duari, the director of MP Birla Planetarium, Kolkata, who found it to be "extremely interesting and strange". Duari later identified the object as be the planet Venus.[4][5][6]

2013[edit]

  • Residents of Mogappiar, Chennai observed five specks of bright orange light moving from south to north around 8.55 pm on 20 June and was later reported on the local newspaper on 23 June.[7]
  • On 4 August, soldiers of Indian Army observed unidentified flying objects over Lagan Kher Area, Demchock, Ladakh. It was also reported that army troops had observed more than a hundred different incidents of UFO movements in the border areas of Arunachal Pradesh in the preceding seven months.[8]

2014[edit]

  • A series of pictures of the sunset over the Rajajipuram area of Lucknow on 23 July claimed to show a UFO.[9]
  • A commercial pilot reportedly informed Mumbai Air Traffic Control room that she spotted a black and blueish UFO near Pune during the first week of October at a height of about 26,300 feet.[10]
  • A photograph published by the news media claimed to show a "nail shaped" UFO over Kochi in the southern Indian state of Kerala on 29 October.[11]

2015[edit]

  • In Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh, a local resident claimed to have taken a photo of a large UFO.[12] However, a rash of similar photos from other parts of the world depicting the appearance of a UFO similar to the one in the movie Independence Day were most likely "created using digital editing software or even a mobile phone app, as some on the market allow UFOs to be blended into pictures".[13]
  • In June, a boy from Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh reportedly captured a flying saucer in his father's phone while clicking photos of clouds.[14]

2021[edit]

  • In January, some local residents from Ludhiana, Punjab claimed that they saw an unidentified flying object (UFO) in the sky.[15] A similar incident occurred in December also.[16]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Drolia, Rashmi (15 July 2014). "10,000-year-old rock paintings depicting aliens and UFOs found in Chhattisgarh". Times of India. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  2. ^ "Top Shelf Witnesses, Kolkata , India".
  3. ^ RAMESH VINAYAK (April 18, 2012). "Was it a spy drone from across the border? Was it a weather balloon? Was it a UFO?". India Today. Retrieved 2021-08-09.
  4. ^ "UFO puzzle has city in a tizzy"
  5. ^ "Did a UFO come over Kolkata?"
  6. ^ "Kolkata in a tizzy over UFO sighting"
  7. ^ "'UFO' sighted in Chennai?". The Hindu. 23 June 2013. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  8. ^ "Army troops sight UFO in Ladakh again". The Hindu. 19 August 2014. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  9. ^ "Is that a UFO flying over Lucknow?". India Today. 24 July 2014. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  10. ^ Avasthi, Yogesh (4 October 2014). "It's a UFO!". Pune Mirror. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  11. ^ "Is this an UFO in the sky above Kochi?". India Today. 30 October 2014. Retrieved 7 December 2014.
  12. ^ http://daily.bhaskar.com/news-hf/TOP-pictures-of-ufo-in-gorakhpur-went-viral-5181358-PHO.html
  13. ^ Austin, Don (14 October 2015). "Biggest, best ever UFO photograph? Witnesses snap 'Independence Day-like mothership'". The Express. Daily Express. Retrieved 30 November 2015. A news agency also released pictures this week of the same UFO allegedly spotted over the Heilongtan Reservoir in south-western China's Sichuan Province. There is also a CGI version of the "mothership" online, suggested the Indian images were created using digital editing software or even a mobile phone app, as some on the market allow UFOs to be blended into pictures.
  14. ^ "Kanpur boy clicks pictures of a UFO, but it is a bit too perfect to be believed". The Indian Express. 2015-06-27. Archived from the original on 2022-05-31. Retrieved 2022-05-31.
  15. ^ "Watch: UFO Spotted In Ludhiana? Residents Claim They Saw Shiny Unidentified Object In Sky". outlook india. 2022-01-19. Archived from the original on 2022-05-31. Retrieved 2022-05-31.
  16. ^ Livemint (2021-12-03). "Mysterious lights spotted in sky in northern India, leave many people puzzled". mint. Archived from the original on 2022-05-31. Retrieved 2022-05-31.
